etymologies: Middle English (denoting an imaginary type of snake): from Old French sirene, from late Latin Sirena, feminine of Latin Siren, from Greek Seirēn

definitions: a device that makes a loud prolonged sound as a signal or warning
shortDefinitions: device that makes loud prolonged signal or warning sound

definitions: each of a number of women or winged creatures whose singing lured unwary sailors on to rocks.
shortDefinitions: woman whose singing lured unwary sailors on to rocks

definitions: a woman who is considered to be alluring or fascinating but also dangerous in some way.
shortDefinitions: woman who is considered to be alluring or fascinating but also dangerous in some way

definitions: an eel-like American amphibian with tiny forelimbs, no hind limbs, small eyes, and external gills, typically living in muddy pools.

notes.text: Family Sirenidae: genera Siren and Pseudobranchus, and three species, including the greater siren (S. lacertina)

shortDefinitions: eel-like American amphibian with tiny forelimbs, no hindlimbs, small eyes, and external gills
